articles.title: Southeast Asian Leaders Call For Immediate End To Violence In Myanmar - NPR
articles.description: Leaders of Southeast Asian nations attended the emergency summit about the situation in Myanmar, where the military has killed nearly 750 civilians since the coup in February.
articles.content:
Indonesian police guard the site of Saturday's ASEAN emergency summit in Jakarta, which drew protests over the invitation of Myanmar's military general.
Ed Wray/Getty Images

articles.title: ASEAN leaders demand immediate end to 'unacceptable' killings in Myanmar, following emergency summit - ABC News
articles.description: South-East Asian leaders say they have agreed on a plan with Myanmar's junta chief to end the crisis in the violence-hit nation, including halting the killing of civilian protesters and accepting humanitarian assistance.

articles.title: ASEAN leaders reach consensus on 'immediate cessation' of violence in Myanmar - CNA
articles.description: SINGAPORE: Leaders of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) have agreed on the need for an immediate stop to the violence in Myanmar after an emergency meeting in Jakarta on Saturday (Apr 24).
